Api¶

This app is made specifically for REST calls. Namely it provides a RESTful interface for mobile application to interact with

api.backends¶

Custom backends are specified here.

class api.backends.CsrfExemptSessionAuthentication[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.authentication.SessionAuthentication

This backend allows the class based views to not require a CSRF Token when accepting a POST request.

enforce_csrf(request)[source]¶

api.permissions¶

This module dictates who is allowed to submit GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE requests to the api views.

There are typically two functions:
has_object_permission(self, request, view, obj)
has_permission(self, request, view)
The initial defines the authentication necessary to view/modify a particular object of the corresponding model.

The latter function defines the authentication necessary to view a list of all the objects or create a new object (POST)

class api.permissions.IsCurrentUserOrSuperUser[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.permissions.BasePermission

Basic User Permissions. You can only view your own User information.

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]¶

Ensures that only User object a current user can view is their own. Ensures that super users can view any User object.

class api.permissions.IsOwnerOfAppointment[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.permissions.BasePermission

Permission for Appointment View - checks for the owner of the appointment.

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]¶

Ensures that only the customer and stylist of an appointment may view or modify the appointment.

has_permission(request, view)[source]¶

Ensures that no anonymous user can view or create an appointment.

class api.permissions.IsOwnerOfHaircut[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.permissions.BasePermission

Permission for Haircut View - checks for the owner of the haircut.

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]¶

Returns True if the Stylist is the owner of the haircut.

has_permission(request, view)[source]¶

Returns True if the user is not anonymous.

class api.permissions.IsUserLoggedIn[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.permissions.BasePermission

Miscellaneous Permissions. Checks to ensure the user is logged in.

has_permission(request, view)[source]¶

Returns true only if the user is not anonymous.

class api.permissions.OnlySuperUsersCanModify[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.permissions.BasePermission

Miscellaneous Permissions. Checks to ensure that the user is a super user.

has_object_permission(request, view, obj)[source]¶

No restrictions on GET request. If the request is not a GET, then it may only be submitted by a superuser.

has_permission(request, view)[source]¶

No restrictions on GET request. If the request is not a GET, then it may only be submitted by a superuser.

    password:Unhashed password if posting - hashed if GET (‘write_only’: True}
    is_stylist:YES or NO
    profile_picture:
     Profile Picture (storage type is FileField) Default is assigned here.

UserSerializer.create(validated_data)[source]¶

Method overrides the default create method. Ensures that password is hashed before stored.

api.urls¶

The Urls from the ViewSets are registered through a router. Standalone method views are manually registered through urlpatterns. The manually registered views (in url patterns) don’t show up in the home page of /api.

api.views¶

Method views are decorated with @api_view(<Array of allowable methods>) and @csrf_exempt (so that the mobile app doesn’t need to retrieve a csrf token before submitting a POST)

CSRF exemption is done on the class based views by setting CsrfExemptSessionAuthentication to its list of authentication_classes

class api.views.AppointmentViewSet(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.viewsets.ModelViewSet

This class handles the interactions with the Appointment database. | The query set only returns Appointments where the stylist or customer of that appointment is the current user. | Before saving a new appointment the customer field is set to be the current user.

class api.views.HaircutViewSet(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: rest_framework.viewsets.ModelViewSet

This class handles the interactions with the PortfolioHaircut model. | It’s important that a parameter is fed to the url like so: | http://www.<domain>.com/api/haircut?stylist_pk=1 | Where the stylist_pk is simply the pk value of the stylist whose haircuts you are trying to view. | If a stylist_pk value is not given then it will retrieve all the PortfolioHaircuts of the current user. | - zero if they’re a customer.

api.views.customer_rating(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
This method has a search parameter:
param customer_pk:
 The pk value of a user.

Every user (including stylists) have a customer_rating. The customer_rating is simply the rating they get as a customer.

The customer’s user object is pulled using the customer_pk
The average_rating is obtained from the average_rating field of the Customer.
The rating is then sent back as a JsonResponse
api.views.stylist_rating(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
This method has a search parameter:
param stylist_pk:
 The pk value of a stylist

Only stylists will have a stylist_rating. Users that aren’t stylists will have a default stylist_rating of zero. The steps to display the stylist ratings are similar to the steps that display a customer_rating.

api.views.stylist_search(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
Method based view that takes a parameter called search
param search:http://www.<domain>.com/api/stylist_search/<search parameter goes here> | The search parameter can be any string

If the search parameter is blank then the method returns every Stylist If the search parameter is not blank then the method returns every Stylist whose username, first_name, or last_name contains the parameter.

api.views.user_login(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple view for user’s to be able to log in.

  • Post Params:
    param username:String
    param password:String, Raw Password
    return:Response(UserSerializer(instance=request.user, context=context).data)

Authentication is run on the given username and password. If authentication is successful the user is logged in.

api.views.user_logout(self, request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
